events.name: March iOS Meetup
events.description:
Please note that we are in a different location! And also, we are on a Sunday because of try! Swift Tokyo.

11:00 am - 11:15 am: Introduction

events.name: 2nd Hackers Meetup: Lightning merchant solution and wallet showcase
events.description:
We're back since our last event in 2014! Since there's no active Bitcoin meetup in Tokyo, we'd thought we bring back our old meetup group to restart things. We're going to start with some talks about recent Lightning developments on both the merchant and wallet sides.

Agenda:

19:00~ Nicolas Dorier on BTCPay Server with Lightning
20:00~ Chris Moss talk on his Lightning wallet

Also as an added bonus, we will have Two Dogs accept Lightning for payment of food and drinks! See you there!

events.name: HN Tokyo - Startup/Biz/Tech/Builder Networking Meetup #91

group.name: Hacker News Tokyo - Business/Technology Networking Meetup

events.description:
Hello,

Weâ€™re happy to announce the next HN Tokyo meetup!

Meetup: The next HN Tokyo meetup will be at Space 0 in Gaiax GRiD Nagatacho (Floor B1 - https://grid.tokyo.jp/event-space/b1f). The space is large and relaxed, itâ€™s easy to talk with people, and thereâ€™s places to sit down and chat.

The space is huge, it's easy to talk with people, and there's places to sit down and chat too. This will be a fun event.

As always, please feel free to bring all your friends who read Hacker News and who are into the business and technology scene. As a general rule, we do not allow financial consultants and recruiters (some but few exceptions apply).

Personal Favour from Jay: I'd really appreciate it if you could avoid messaging me about whether you can come or not. If you can make it, that's great. It's not a problem if you come late, or can't come for any reason.

Price

It's 1,000 yen to get in, and there is food and drink available at the venue.

Time

The event will go from 6:30pm to 10:00pm.

Questions

If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact me.

Looking forward to seeing you soon!

events.name: Coffee and Code

venue.name: Starbucks in Roppongi Hills Lobby (THERE ARE TWO, PLEASE READ BELOW)

events.description:
We will start at 10 am.

***

Coffee and Code is a relaxed event for people who code or people who want to start.

Bring a laptop and grab a coffee. Talk about what you're coding or what you're learning. Get help and share tips.

***

If you get lost, stand by the spider statue outside and send a message to the meetup discussion board describing what kind of shirt you're wearing and I'll come outside and rescue you.

I've limited the RSVP to 12. If you're on the waitlist, feel free to come anyway, but know that we may not all be able to sit together if there's more than that.
events.how_to_find_us: Go into the main entrance (the one by the giant scary spider statue) you will see some escalators and a Starbucks. Ignore that Starbucks. Take the escalator downstairs towards the parking lot. You'll see another Starbucks directly below. That one.

events.name: Weekend Coffee for Startup People
events.description:
Any plans for the weekend?

This event brings together a small group of local entrepreneurs over a cup of coffee, in a relaxing and informal atmosphere. It's your chance to make new connections, share advice, and brainstorm new ideas with the people that are trying to build a new project or start a freelancing career.

This event is self-organized for the local startup community. If you arrive first at the cafe, just pick a table and post in the group comments below where you are sitting and how to identify you (e.g. shirt color).

Are you interested in leading this event on a weekly basis? Send us a quick email to [masked] to get more details.

Enjoy your coffee with new friends!

events.name: Free Python training weekly follow-up
events.description:
Welcome all Python beginners / intermediate / experts!

This meeting is to assist people learning Python programming language and to give opportunity to those experienced in Python to teach and help others.

[For beginners / intermediate]

We use materials from the on-line edX course from MITx named "Introduction to Computer Science and Programming Using Python".

Link here for more details: https://www.edx.org/course/introduction-computer-science-mitx-6-00-1x-11

The course is self-paced, and it is available until August 31, 2018. After the date we'll probably choose another course to follow.

Regardless if you are already following the course, or just curious and you would like to have a look, feel free to come.

[For intermediate / experts]

If you are good in Python programming, you are also very welcome to join.

Feel free to suggest a 10 min presentation. As the venue's infrastructure (network, projector, screen, video ports, etc.) may vary, please contact us for details.

[Venue]
Yahoo Lodge: https://goo.gl/maps/ptPWV8UayiL2
Closest stations: Nagatacho (Yurakucho, Hanzomon, Nanboku lines) and Akasaka Mitsuke (Ginza, Marunouchi lines).

[Please]
1) bring your laptop or anything you can write Python code with.
2) if you need help to set-up your Python environment, we will dedicate time for that. Solution for everything.

[Schedule]
19:30 - 21:00 (closed)

[Fee]
Participation is free.

Thank you.
events.how_to_find_us: Take the elevator to Yahoo Lodge (18F), register at the reception desk, then go down to 17F.

events.name: World Blockchain Tour Tokyo - Token Economy and Blockchain Business in 2019
events.description:
We will hold a conference event with the theme "How to update life with token economy" and "The prospect of block chain business in 2019 in Asia".

We are welcoming guests who are running Japan's leading token economy service and guests who are active in the front lines of block chain business in Korea, China and Taiwan.
We will also make pitch events for block chain related services.
We will deliver from Tokyo, the center of Japan, to the world the road marks that the future block chain business should aim for.

Capacity: 250 people (free entrance/registration required)
ï¼ŠPlease register beforehand. You will not be able to enter without a previous registration. Please bring the ticket with you.
ï¼ŠWe are announcing this event on other event sites as well. Therefore, we may need to close the participate before the number of participant has reached the maximum on the MeetUp Website.
ï¼ŠWe may have to change the title and the speakers without any announcement.

ã€ˆEvent Overviewã€‰
Date and timeï¼šMarch 23rd, 2019 (Saturday) 19:00ã€œ22:00
ï¼ŠEntrance reception: 18:30ã€œ18:55
Venueï¼šä¸¸ã®å†…(marunouchi)vacans
Address: FLOC Blockchain 2F, 3-1-1, Marunouchi, Chiyoda-ku, Tokyo
Access: JRLine, 2 minutes by walk from Yurakucho Station
Fee: FREE
Reception: Please present your business card at the reception. If you do not have it, please present any ID documents with your name shown.
Languages: Japanese or English (In case of Korean and Chinese, we will have translation apps that would translate in Japanese)

ã€ˆTarget Audience ã€‰
ãƒ»Participants involved in block chain business
ãƒ»Those who are doing start-up business
ãƒ»For engineers who are interested in block chains
ãƒ»Operator of block chain media
ãƒ»Those interested in building tokens economies and communities
ãƒ»Business Person Â· Producer Â· Company Manager Â· Student

ã€ˆAbout Blockfanzã€‰
Blockfanz provides marketing support services and consulting services for high quality block chain projects in Korea, Japan, Hong Kong and Taiwan and other Asian countries.

We also host a block chain conference called the World Blockchain Tour (WBT), and in September of this year we held a WBT in Taipei, Taiwan. WBT aims to promote the block chain industry in the Asian region and to provide a place to be a source of community creation.

ã€ˆRequest and Consultationã€‰

Blockfanz accepts requests and consultations on block chains and token economies.
Please feel free to inquire about STO project and block chain business consultation, and also at STO and seminar lecturer on block chains.

events.name: Online - Blockchain User Certification
events.description:
****ONLINE ONLY****

Online Blockchain User Certification, in order to take the course you must register below, we are providing a 50% Discount for our Meetup Members.

Coupon Code: Block50 - use this code when you checkout.

Register Here: https://tinyurl.com/UserCertification

Course Syllabus:

Introduction
What is Blockchain
Blockchain Glossary
We provide 64 technical terms and definitions that relate to blockchain technology.
Why is Blockchain a revolutionary Technology
Blockchain Applications by Industry
Blockchain Transaction Model
Bitcoin & Blockchain: how are they connected
What is a Cryptocurrency
Bitcoin: A Peer to Peer Electronic Cash System
Benefits of using Blockchain Technology
Consensus
Consensus Protocol
Safety
Liveness
Fault Tolerance
Blockchain Fork
Consensus Failure
Dominance
Cheating
Poor Performance
Choosing the right blockchain
What is Cryptography
Cryptographic encryption
Elliptic-curve Cryptography (ECC)
What is Blockchain Mining (Bitcoin Examples)
The Computationally-Difficult Program
The Difficulty Metric
Block Reward
Hardware
Blockchain Business Use Cases
Private vs. Public Blockchain
Permissionless vs. Permissioned
What is Ethereum
Proof of Work
Solidity
Homestead
EthHash
Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)
Serenity (POS)
What is Microsoft Azure Workbench Blockchain
What is Hyperledger
Hyperledger Fabric
The Practical Byzantine Fault Tolerance (PBFT)
SIEVE
Cross-Fault Tolerance (XFT)
Hyperledger SawtoothLake
Proof of Elapsed Time
Hyperledger Iroha
Hyperledger Burrow
What is Ripple & Stellar Blockchain
Ripple Consensus Protocol Algorithm
Stellar Consensus Protocol Algorithm
What is a Smart contract
What is Proof of Stake
What is the EOS blockchain
Proof of Stake
EOS Vs. Ethereum
Denial of Service Attacks
Consensus Mechanism & Governance
What is Bitshares Blockchain & DEX
Delegated Proof of Stake (DPOS)
Transaction Confirmation
Proof of Stake Consensus
Block Production by Elected Witnesses
Parameter Change by Elected Delegates
Changing the Rules (aka Hard Forks)
Double Spend Attack
Transactions as Proof of Stake
Blockchain Reorganizations
Maximally Decentralized
NEM Blockchain Review
AI / Quantum computing and Blockchain

We will provide an online exam to provide your final grade and certificate of completion.

events.name: PC Maintenance (Hardware & Software)
events.description:
PC Maintenance (Hardware & Software)

We use both English and Japanese in event.
In this course, we will teach you some basic knowledge about hardware, so that you can better understand your personal computer.

events.name: ML Math: Intro to Bayesian Inference
events.description:
Welcome to our first ML Math Lecture. :)

In this session, we are looking at fundamentals of Bayesian Inference for Machine Learning. Hiroshi Urata will show how to deal with some mathematical expressions such as derivation of posterior distribution and predictive distribution. The lecture is designed for entry level who are very interested in the mathematics behind machine learning.

-- AGENDA --
14:00-14:10: Welcome note
14:10-14:50: Basic Probability Theory, Maximum Likelihood Estimation - Hiroshi Urata, Data Scientist (IBM)
14:50-15:05: Break
15:05-15:50: Introduction to Bayesian Inference
15:50-16:00: Closing

-- SPEAKER --
Hiroshi Urata is a Data Scientist at IBM Japan. He runs a blog on Machine Learning, covering topics such as Machine Learning Math, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing and more. https://hiroshiu.blogspot.com/

-- THANKS --
A big Thank You goes out to Progate for having us. Progate is an online platform for learning to code with more than half a million users, 700 companies and 80 schools. https://progate.com/

-- JOIN US --
ML engineers, researchers and students can join MLT on:
[Slack] https://goo.gl/WnbYUP

-- MLT PATRON --
Become a MLT Patron and help us to keep MLT meetups like this inclusive and for free. https://www.patreon.com/MLTOKYO

Find MLT resources
Github: https://github.com/Machine-Learning-Tokyo
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/MLTOKYO

-- RECRUITING --
MLT events are for community building and knowledge sharing. We politely ask that company representatives, recruiters and consultants looking to hire or sell their services do not come to this event. Thank you.

events.name: Kaggle Earthquake Prediction (study group)
events.description:
In this study group we will tackle the Kaggle Earthquake Prediction. https://www.kaggle.com/c/LANL-Earthquake-Prediction

Forecasting earthquakes is one of the most important problems in Earth science because of their devastating consequences. Current scientific studies related to earthquake forecasting focus on three key points: when the event will occur, where it will occur, and how large it will be.

In this competition, you will address when the earthquake will take place. Specifically, youâ€™ll predict the time remaining before laboratory earthquakes occur from real-time seismic data.

-- AGENDA --
10:00 - 13:00: Opens study group with the goal to submit one or more predictions

-- THANKS --
A big Thank You goes out to Progate for having us. Progate is an online platform for learning to code with more than half a million users, 700 companies and 80 schools. https://progate.com/

Join our hands-on 2-2.5-hour data science workshop this week.

Computer vision is an AI technology that allows computers to understand and label images. Today, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) are commonly applied to analyzing visual imagery; and it surpassed traditional hand-crafted features. Come and join our Computer Vision battleground this week! Don't waste your time and invest in your future!

Register here : https://tokyotechies.com/courses/data-science-battleground/

Format of the event:
13:30 - 14:00: Registration
14:00 - 14:15: Guest speaker
14:15 - 15:00: Dataset exploration and basic solution
15:00 - 15:45: Improve the basic solution
15:45 - 16:00: Presentation of the best solution
16:00 - 16:30: Networking

First come, first served! Maximum of 20 attendees only. Register online to secure your seat. The door will be open at 1:30 PM for walk-in registrants. We will close the door once the workshop starts, so please donâ€™t be late!

Early bird registration: 1500 yen (Online payment / Or write us an email to reserve at [masked] with title: â€œRegister for Round #5 DSBGâ€)

At the doors: 2000 yen.

(æ—¥æœ¬èªä¸‹è¨˜)

Hi! I am Dai from Team AI.

We keep getting info about the latest AI technology everyday.

It is impossible to read everything.

However it is important to catch up the main innovation.

This event is discussion group of each month's state-of-art ML technology.

We have an interactive and fun conversation for 2hours.

And menbers can keep posting related URL links in our Slack group.

www.team-ai.com => Please log in from this Slack icon.

Topic;

- Latest ML research paper

- Latest output from ML conference

- Latest output from DeepMind/OpenAI

- Latest output from Google/Facebook/Amazon/Microsoft/IBM

- Topic from AI startups

- Fun and creative ML use cases which getting popular in social media.

Sounds interesting? Please just come to our "Team AI Base" in Shibuya and work together. Are you a beginner? Don't worry. We will take care of you.

Let's have a fun together in building a good AI.

events.name: Designing for Sustainability: introduction and best practices by an SDG expert
events.description:
DESIGNING FOR SUSTAINABILITY: INTRODUCTION AND BEST PRACTICES

How do you design for sustainability? How do you create local impact, for a global goal? How do you know which challenge to tackle, and how do you map out who is impacted by your work?

With the setting of the Global Goals for Sustainable Development by the UN, global communities are answering a call to action to contribute to the worldâ€™s sustainable development. But, as a creative or designer, how do you translate these big global goals into local action?

With our annual Global Goals Jam, we have created a community of changemakers that do exactly this. Weâ€™ll share some of the learnings and best practices from this community â€“ on how to creating relevant design challenges, designing roadmaps for sustainable development, and tracking impact.

Weâ€™ll also introduce you to a couple of tools from the Jamkit used in the Global Goals Jam, and show you how to craft your own local challenge.

events.name: Le Wagon Open Day
events.description:
Looking for a life changing start to 2019?

If you are thinking of a career change into tech, want to become a full stack developer or launch your own tech startup, learning how to code is a pretty good start. ğŸ’»

*********************************************************

Sign up here (https://lewagontokyo.typeform.com/to/suOiZR) to book a time to meet with the team

*********************************************************

At Le Wagon, we offer a 9-week coding bootcamp which has been tried and tested by over 4,000 alumni since 2013, who have gone on to be developers, product managers, startup founders and more.

If you'd like to learn more, come to Le Wagon Tokyo's Open Day - sign up HERE (https://lewagontokyo.typeform.com/to/suOiZR)and choose a suitable date and time. Itâ€™s a great chance to meet the team and see the class in action.

We'll run over the program, products built by our alumni, where they currently are with their careers and what theyâ€™re building now. The next Tokyo cohort starts on April 15th and July 1st 2019.
We also have sessions in Kyoto! The next one will be starting May 20th.

Take a look at the products built by our previous batches in just 10 days:

https://www.lewagon.com/demoday/58
https://www.lewagon.com/demoday/78
https://www.lewagon.com/demoday/94

If you want to come and can't make these times, email us on [masked] to arrange another time to meet.

See you soon!

#CloudStudyJam

~~~~~~~~~~~~
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile.

You will be able to get hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)!
The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.
For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

**Time Table
0:30pm: Doors Open
0:50pm: Opening
1:00pm: ML labs & Kubernetes labs
2:30pm: Break
3:00pm: ML labs & Kubernetes labs
4:00pm: After Party
5:00pm: Event ends
**Hands-on Tutor
GCPUG Tokyo

events.name: Liquid Meetup ft. Orbs, Tokyo
events.description:
The Liquid team will be hosting an event in our Tokyo office on the 26th March and we would love to meet you! Joining us will be the Orbs team from Israel.

We would like to invite local Liquid exchange users, traders, the local crypto community, tech enthusiasts along with our QASH holders to join us for a night of networking and collaboration amongst like minded people.

We will be sharing the latest news, updates and top level insights on both Liquid and Orbs. There will also be a Q&A session at the end so feel free to ask us anything!

*This is a FREE event

Agenda for the evening:
- Intro of Liquid by Seth Melamed, Global Head of Business Development
- Status update on Orbs by Daniel Peled, Co-founder and President
- Special announcements from Liquid & Orbs

Please RSVP here to secure your spot:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd2476Z86YWEeS_7FZzdNNHvGwGoJT1XIIKUXLiMafj16Pb_w/viewform
*first 100 rsvps only

About Orbs:
Orbs is a hybrid blockchain that scales base-layer protocols. It is the first customizable public blockchain designed to provide flexibility for the ever-evolving needs of real businesses. With built-in interoperability, Orbs serves as a â€œmiddlewareâ€ solution for dApps with millions of users looking for a sustainable stacking solution. Our Ethereum Interoperability architecture strategy allows dApps to enjoy the best of two chains: uncompromising security, liquidity and ecosystem integration, production-ready scalability, suitable fee structures, business model flexibility and speed that does not compromise on security. This combination of Ethereum and Orbs is the optimal hybrid solution for apps looking to adopt blockchain, today. Orbs is one of four companies named by Gartner as a â€œCool Vendor in Blockchain Technologyâ€ in 2018.
